source.g: A developer creates a new Visualforce page and Apex extension, and writes test classes that exercise 95% coverage of the new Apex extension. Change set deployment to production fails with the test coverage warning: "Average test coverage across all Apex classes and triggers is 74%, at least 75% test coverage is required." What can the developer do to successfully deploy the new Visualforce page and extension?
Create test classes to exercise the Visualforce page markup.
Incorrect. Test classes can cover only Apex classes, not Visualforce pages.
Select Fast Deployment to bypass running all the tests.
Incorrect. The correct wording is “quick deployment”, but the developer still wants to make sure all tests pass, so running a quick deployment is not enough.
Select 'Disable Parallel Apex Testing' to run all the tests.
Incorrect. Disabling parallel Apex testing does not change the 75% code coverage requirement.
Add test methods to existing test classes from previous deployments.
Correct. This increases the code coverage on the rest of the Apex classes in the org.
1. Change the “X” in “Question 1 of X” to the total number of questions (do this on all questions).
2. Type or paste the questions in the questions section.
3. Type or paste the answers in the answer sections.
4. Type or paste the feedback for each answer.
5. In slide actions, click script_window and adjust the following:
= number of correct answers for this question
- ans1 = the letter of the correct answer
- ans2 = if there is a second correct answer, change to the applicable answer letter
- ans3 = if there is a third correct answer, change to the applicable answer letter
If you need an option E (a fifth answer)
2. Re-position all the items back into the fluid boxes (drag until box turns green).
3. From the last slide, copy and paste the three items to the appropriate emply fluid boxes.
4. Click each of the three items and ensure the labels (in Properties tab) are as follows:
Which is an accurate statement about creating unit tests in Apex?
Increased test coverage requires large test classes with many lines of code in one method.
Incorrect. The number of lines of code in the test class does not matter, what matters is the amount of lines that the unit test covers.
Triggers do not require any unit tests in order for you to deploy them from sandbox to production.
Incorrect. Triggers need to be covered by unit tests as well in order to be deployed.
Unit tests with multiple methods result in all methods failing when one method fails.
Incorrect. When one method fails, the other test methods can still succeed.
System assert statements that do not increase code coverage contribute important feedback in unit tests.
Correct. Tests should assert your application’s behavior to ensure quality of code and verify expected results.
What is the proper process for an Apex unit test?
Create data for testing. Call the method being tested. Verify that the results are correct.

Correct. Creating your own data makes the method independent of the data in your org. Doing this helps to avoid errors when moving your code from one org to another. To verify that the method works as expected, call it using different inputs based on the data that was created.
. Call the method being tested. Verify that the results are correct.
Incorrect. SeeAllData=true should only be used in specific scenarios when the data cannot be created on the test class.
. Verify that the results are correct.
Incorrect. runAllTests() executes all the methods in the test class.
. Verify that the results are correct.
Incorrect. SeeAllData=true should only be used in specific scenarios when the data cannot be created on the test class.

A developer has a single custom controller class that works with a Visualforce wizard to support creating and editing multiple sObjects. The wizard accepts data from user inputs across multiple Visualforce pages and from a parameter on the initial URL. Which three statements are necessary inside the unit test for the custom controller? (Select three answers.)
Correct. You need to set the current page to make sure you get the initial URL parameter.
Correct. This statement instantiates a new controller with all parameters in the page.
Correct. This line is used to inject the query parameter ?input=TestValue in the URL for the page.
Incorrect. This is the declaration of the constructor for a controller extension. This is not needed in the test class.

An org has different Apex classes that provide account-related functionality. After a new validation rule is added to the Account object, many of the test methods fail. Which two actions will resolve the failures and reduce the number of code changes needed for future validation rules? (Select two answers.)
Create a method that creates valid account records, and call this method from within test methods.
Correct. In test classes, the developer needs to first create the test records.
Create a method that queries for valid account records, and call this method from within test methods.
Incorrect. The developer needs to create the test records before querying them.
Create a method that loads valid account records from a static resource, and call this method within test methods.
Correct. In test classes, the developer needs to first populate the test records.
Create a method that performs a callout for a valid account record, and call this method from within test methods.
Incorrect. The developer needs to create the test records before validating them.

When working in a sandbox environment, which two things should the developer use to verify the functionality of a new test class before the developer deploys that test class to production? (Select two answers.)
Test menu in the Developer Console
Correct. In the Developer Console, you can execute some or all tests in specific test classes, set up and run test suites, or run all tests.
Run Tests menu page in Salesforce Setup
Incorrect. There is not a page called Run Tests in Salesforce Setup.
Incorrect. There is not a method called ApexTestRun.
Apex Test Execution page in Salesforce Setup
Correct. You can run unit tests on the Apex Test Execution page. The Apex Test Execution page refreshes the status of a test and displays the results after the test completes.

A developer has a block of code that omits any statements that indicate whether the code block should execute with or without sharing. What will automatically obey the organization-wide defaults and sharing settings for the user who executes the code in the Salesforce organization?

Incorrect. Apex generally runs in system context; meaning the current user's permissions, field-level security, and sharing rules aren’t taken into account during code execution. Apex controllers do not change this behavior.

Incorrect. Apex generally runs in system context; meaning the current user's permissions, field-level security, and sharing rules aren’t taken into account during code execution. Apex triggers do not change this behavior.
Correct. Anonymous blocks can execute existing Apex classes, not merely lines of code written in the anonymous block window. Anonymous blocks execute using the full permissions of the current user.

Incorrect. Apex generally runs in system context; meaning the current user's permissions, field-level security, and sharing rules aren’t taken into account during code execution. HTTP callouts do not change this behavior.
